parameters: This is the source of the voice.
All that can be heard now is the echoes of raindrops.
If you wish to save the person trapped in the well, you will need to construct a rope.
The well leads into inky darkness.
You currently hold \c[5]\v[4]\c[0] piece of possible \c[5]rope\c[0].
You currently hold \c[5]\v[4]\c[0] pieces of possible \c[5]rope\c[0].
Going in without a \c[5]rope\c[0] is unwise.
Tie them together and begin descent?
It's a letter addressed to Papa. Read it?
I hope this letter finds you well.
I am writing to you from Mother's home, as she required extra help regarding the pig farm.
She is personally doing well and has asked about you and Lily.
Mother is especially curious about your progress on your research project.
When Mother heard that you were pursuing her specialty, she was delighted to see how you would do. Please write to her and possibly send samples.
I only expect to stay on the farm for the next year or so before returning to Maine. With your permission, I'd like to visit your home on the way.
You already cut the rope down. Nothing else to do here.
The rope holds strong, but the shears should cut them.
Cut and take the \c[5]tire swing rope \c[0]for climbing?
The rope holds thick, but the swing goes down.
There's no more vine here left to cut. Nothing left to do, but let nature heal.
This vine might be able to serve as a possible \c[5]rope\c[0].
Cut and take the \c[5]blue thorned vine \c[0]for climbing?
You carefully cut down the vine and use the shears to trim down the thorns.
There's no more vine here left to cut. Nothing left to do, but let nature heal.
This vine might be able to serve as a possible \c[5]rope\c[0].
Cut and take the \c[5]yellow flowering vine \c[0]for climbing?
You carefully cut down the vine, but petals and pollen still get everywhere.
There's no more vine here left to cut. Nothing left to do, but let nature heal.
This vine might be able to serve as a possible \c[5]rope\c[0].
Cut and take the \c[5]red berry vine \c[0]for climbing?
You carefully cut down the vine, squishing many berries in the process.
You took all of the chain, creating a new safety hazard.
If you tried to use the shears on these, they'd probably break.
...You aren't going to put your hands in deeper just for more hair.
You might be able to cut this hair for a \c[5]rope\c[0]...
Cut and take the oily hair for \c[5]rope\c[0]?
As soon at you cut off some hair, the rest gets quickly sucked into the liquid below.

no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no no
If you jam the shears in here, it will probably stop the fan.
You jam the shears into the fan, breaking it.
Before anything else can happen, you crawl past it.
The net seems to be pretty sturdy.
Cut it and use it as \c[5]rope\c[0]?
You cut the net, freeing it from the stakes it was attached to.
Haven't you done enough, you little monster?
You already killed him. He isn't coming back.
Even if it wasn't you who did it, it was still \c[5]you\c[0].
There isn't anything to snip here.
There's a receipt from a place called Sac Supply. Read it?
There's a small note written at the bottom of the paper.
It reads: "No new orders for a bit. Too much local attention. Watch the news."
You already cut the rope down. Nothing else to do here.
You try using the bolt cutters on the rope.
...but it just results in the rope getting squished.
You should probably think about the difference between metal and rope.
There's no more vine here left to cut. Nothing left to do, but let nature heal.
While you technically use the bolt cutters on the vine, it just crushes the vine.
There's no more vine here left to cut. Nothing left to do, but let nature heal.
While you technically use the bolt cutters on the vine, it just crushes the vine.
There's no more vine here left to cut. Nothing left to do, but let nature heal.
While you technically use the bolt cutters on the vine, it just crushes the vine.
You took all of the chain, creating a new safety hazard.
The chains lining the bridge could make for a good rope.
It takes some extra strength, but you manage to snip the chain.
The net seems to be pretty sturdy.
Cut it and use it as \c[5]rope\c[0]?
You cut the net, freeing it from the stakes it was attached to.
You'd probably be able to get through the door if you cut the bars.
You break through the bars and unlock the door from the other side.
These bars are much too thick to use the bolt cutters on.
You REALLY aren't allowed in the pantry.
Papa can probably get a new one.
There isn't anything to snip here.
If you put the rock in the water, it might help make a path accross.
Place the rock in the water?
You carefully put the rock in the water.
Where the hell did you find this rock? This is something you should probably tell Ice about.
The rock is very heavy... Would you like to put it back?
The rock is very heavy... Would you like to put it back?
The rock is very heavy... Would you like to put it back?
If you want to put the rock down, you should at least put it in the general area you found it in.
There's a worn birthday card. Read it?
The front of the card has a picture of a black rabbit holding a flower.
It reads: "Happy ONE year of being here".
On the inside is a picture of even more black rabbits holding flowers.
It reads: "Happy First Birthday Lily, July 20th, 1985"
"You've grown so much in just a year! Never forget that you are surrounded by people who love you!"
There's a safe with a keypad on it.
It seems to have space for six numbers.
Oh? That seems to be the right password. What a clever child.
Oh? That seems to be the right password. What a clever child.
Ah. That seems to be wrong.
There's a long whip inside the safe.
The whip is long and completely unfrayed.
It could make for a good rope.
Papa won't be happy with this.
You currently have no pieces of \c[5]rope material\c[0].

You can probably knit the yarn you have into a stronger rope.
Knit the ball of yarn into a \c[5]knitted rope\c[0]?
Despite your knitting experience, there's nothing to knit here.
There isn't anything left to knit.
You can probably knit the yarn you have into a stronger rope.
Knit the ball of yarn into a \c[5]knitted rope\c[0]?
Your knitting needles are thin enough to get past the bars.
Use them to pull in the key?
Despite your knitting experience, there's nothing to knit here.
It's a book on the local plant life in your area. Read it?
Which section would you like to read?
Greetings and thank you for picking up my guide for the special flora located in Bethany's Mirror, Vermont.
I am Magus Bergamot, a resident of the Bethany's Mirror area since childhood. I have spent my years studying the various unique plants that only grow in this pocket of the world.
Many of these plants take on unique and unexpected roles in their ecosystems, as well as provide plenty of uses for local foragers.
Like with any plant or fungal life, it is important to properly identify anything you are foraging. Failure to do so can lead to extreme injury or death.
It is additionally important to not violate anyone's personal territory while foraging. An angry resident of Bethany's Mirror is far worse than any moose.
With all of that out of the way, let's take a look at the most common specimens you will find in this area.
The majority of the trees found in Bethany's Mirror are the same as those in the surrounding areas. Plenty of oak, maple, and pine to go around.
The most common of the area's more unusual trees is the Nymph Mimic.
It will appear as a normal birch tree, but with a female humanoid figure jutting out of the trunk.
Despite appearances this isn't an actual nymph, but a soulless tree.
Theses trees seem to form from the souls of women who get lost in the woods or have their corpses dumped in the woods after being killed.
Their souls leave an imprint of sorts on a tree in Bethany's Mirror, causing it to swell with the body's shape.
The sap from these protrusions can be harvested and made into nymph syrup.
Another commonly seen tree that's exclusive to this area is the Tomb Tree.
While harmless toward humanoids in most cases, this tree can pose a risk to small children and pets.
The Tomb Tree appears as a dead and hollow oak tree, usually in the center of a clearing.
While most small animals that come across it may be interested in making a home out of the tree's many tunnels, this is actually a trap.
Thanks to the Tomb Tree's lack of leaves, it instead gains nutrients by digesting the animals that get stuck in the tar-like sap it secretes inside its tunnels.
The death of these animals is slow and full of suffering. Instead of dying of their flesh being digested, they often die of dehydration or starvation first.
If something or someone you care about gets stuck in this tree's sap, common store-bought dish soap is enough to disconnect skin from the sap.
The vined plants of Bethany's Mirror can be some of the most dangerous and the most useful for foragers.
When looking for foraged materials, the most dangerous vine to stay away from is the Overcast Vamp-Vine.
This vine can be identified by its bright purple suction cup-like leaves that only open rainy or overcast nights.
Touching these leaves will cause the vine to grab its new prey and attach as many suction cups as possible to the victim's skin.
It will then use these suction cups to rip the victim's skin open and suck out all of their blood until they're bone dry.
Another vine that can be dangerous is the Womb Ripper.
Despite it's name, it doesn't actually rip out wombs, but its danger still cannot be underestimated.
The Womb Ripper is only dangerous for those who eat the bright red berries off of its vines. Touching or squashing the berries appears to be harmless.
After being consumed, the berries will latch onto the inner linings of its new host's stomach and intestines.
Like a tapeworm, the seeds inside the berries will steal nutrients from the host before eventually sprouting.

Sensing the sun outside of the body, the new plants will violently burst out of the host's organs, likely leaving the host to bleed out and the new vines to grow on the nearest tree or other large object.
The body will be used by the Womb Ripper as extra food throughout its life.
Luckily, the Womb Ripper vine becomes very brittle shortly after seperating it from its root. This makes it easy to incinerate.
One vine that is both dangerous and useful for foragers is known as Orderly's Punishment.
Often found in shady areas along tall trees, Orderly's Punishment can be easily identified by the blue thorns growing along it.

Take extra care to not get pricked by these thorns, as they will inject an intense hallucinogen that will last around twelve hours on average. They will additionally cause an intense itchy sensation on the victim's inner organs.
By removing these thorns though, this vine can be used as a very helpful building material. It is capable of holding an average of 460 pounds of weight, even after being dried out.
For those suffering from joint pains, you may want to look for the Flower of Icarus.
This yellow flowering vine grows swiftly in the rain and thrives in deep wooded areas.
By licking the pollen off the flowers once a day, humanoid joints will begin to repair themselves.
It is however very important to not take the vine itself or pick the flowers.
After being removed from where it originally planted its roots, the plant will quickly start growing micro-fractures, causing it to be easily destroyed after little amounts of pressure.
Going around Bethany's Mirror, there are plenty of root vegetables that can be found only here.
This is due to the area's creation and the impact the outside has on it.
The Dwarf Mandragora can be found by paved roads near the area's border.
Despite its name, it is not in the Mandragora genus, rather the Daucus genus.
They appear as inch-wide clusters of white flowers that grow at the side of the road.
Picking them will reveal a purple root vegetable in the shape of a human baby. These vegetables range from three to five inches tall.
They can cause mild stomach discomfort if eaten raw, but boiling them kills the toxin that causes this.
Dwarf Mandragora is best served with melted cheese and beef.
The rest of this section's pages seem to have been cut out with scissors in order to keep the recipes.
The knife might fit in the memorial's hole...
You slowly stab the knife into the memorial...
It's a perfect fit, but you lost the \c[4]knife\c[0].
There's no more vine here left to cut. Nothing left to do, but let nature heal.
You stab into the vine, but the knife isn't really effective for plant management.
You took all of the chain, creating a new safety hazard.
You stab at the chains, but the knife just kind of slips off the metal and gets lodged in one of the chain loops.
A strong pull lets you get your (stolen) knife back.
A knife won't help you here.
Would you like to see previous versions' patrons?
Join at patreon.com/pureiceblue to be featured.
It's a letter with a red wax seal. Read it?
Dear College of Azoth staff members,
Many of you are already aware of Project Nymph's progress at this point in time.
While we all certainly share excitement with the start of the iterative learning process stage, many have additionally noticed the side-effects created by the previous step.
Our janitorial staff is working hard to push back the mercurial flooding and the capillum tendrils.
In the meantime, it is recommended to use large objects as bridges if you or your students need to cross flooded areas.
We are all very sorry for the trouble.
It's a letter with a coffee mug stain. Read it?
There was a recent case of multiple outsider vehicles making onto the roads of our community.
Investigations have shown that they were not students of our local college, and instead ordinary Vermont residents.
The majority of them have been directed to the outside world without issue, but some have fallen prey to our local wildlife.
If you see an unknown vehicle without a mirror charm in their rear view window, please redirect them to the main road.
It's a letter with terrible handwriting. Read it?
I wanted to check in on you.
You don't pick up when I call you, but I guess it's just safe to assume you're teaching all the time now.
I know it's probably lonely without me there, but I still don't have any plans to come back. I won't go down the same path as you.
If you care though, I have a boyfriend now.
His name's Jeremy. We're both living in an apartment under his mom's house.
I told him all about you and.. well...
He says that he'd rip you limb from limb if he ever met you.
So... Yeah. It'd be cool if you called me on my new cellphone number, but you'd definitely die if you tried to find me.
It's a letter with a fancy envelope. Read it?
How is everything with your little Lily?
It feels like it's been so long since she was first born.
I will never forget how nervous you were during the labor to the point you cried! I'd never seen you cry before then!
You held her and called it the most important day of your life. I nearly cried myself!
I know it's been a while, so I've been curious how she's doing in that cabin of yours.
With you working yourself half to death, it should be fine for me to watch her for a night or two, right?
I'm sure you could use the pressure off your shoulders haha!
I'll come as soon as you call, alright?
...Maybe the thing watching you is hungry.
Toss the jerky into the woods?
You throw the jerky as far as you can.
Use the arrow keys to move Lily around.
Lily can also move by clicking on a desired location.
Objects can be interacted with by pressing the [Z] or [Space] key in front of it.
This can also be done by clicking or tapping on the object.
This game auto-saves to keep track of progress. It can be safely exited at most times.
To speed up text and go through it automatically, hold the [W] key.
Certain objects and structures require the usage of other items in order to progress.
To use an item, open up the Menu Screen with the [Esc] or [X] key.
You can also access acquired items directly from the examine menu.
On the Menu Screen, select the [Stuff] option to access collected items.
By selecting an item and using it on Lily, she will use it.
Lily must be right in front of the item's target in order to use it.
Some items have multiple places they can be used, so don't be afraid to get creative.
There are four different types of items: Stuff, Ropes, Keys, and Files.
Stuff makes up normal items that can be used to interact with objects outside of the menu.
These often have more than one use, so its recommended to play around with them if stuck.
Ropes are the main goal to work toward.
These items are what Lily needs to climb down the well. The more obtained, the further down she can get.
It is important to note that not all ropes are good materials.
Once a rope is collected, it cannot be put back until Lily climbs down the well.
Keys are... keys. They open up certain doors and can be used infinitely in any playthrough.
Finally, files are notes, letters, books... They're really anything that can be read. Just like these instructions.
Even if not directly taken, any file read during a playthrough can be reread from the file section for ease of access.
After collecting at least one piece of rope material, Lily can climb down into the well.
The material quality and length affect the overall result of the descent. Bad materials will cause the rope to break.
NOTE: Once Lily goes down the well, there is no going back.
There's a folder containing documents on Generation Iteration Development. Read it?
There's a lot of words you don't understand, so you lightly skim the folder.
"Our many attempts at the Nymph Project GID have yielding a nearly exact physical replica of the original donor."\^
"This has been done through the use of raw azoth extracted from lich sample S, the donor's DNA, and sacrificial supply specialty orders."\^
"The failed bodies for the Nymph Project have been recycled for their meat or put under observation for alchemic students and professors."\^
"As for the Nymph Project's soul, it was created from ███████, █████, ███████, and the residual soul fragments left behind in the donor's longtime place of residence."\^
"The homunculus is currently at the normal intelligence for a nine-year-old child."\^
"Whenever the homunculus's actions result in the death of its body, project members return to the experiment site and return variables to how they were previously."\^
"Each time the homunculus is terminated, it seems to partially learn from its mistakes, despite the brain not actually holding memory of its previous actions."\^
"There is no current estimation for when the homunculus will be too frightened to even go near the entrance to the disposal pit."\^
...You skim it so fast that you don't actually read anything in the folder.
Tip: Certain large objects result in different results when interacting with them from different angles.
Tip: There are fifteen total rope materials that can be found, but not all of them should be collected and used.
Tip: Whenever Lily dies, there is a chance for a new letter to appear in the mailbox in further playthroughs.
Tip: Rocks can be placed back in the same area where they're found if their speed penalty is too much.
Tip: The item menu can still be used when looking at areas close up.
Tip: If a bad rope material is picked up, it will automatically be used when descending the well.
Tip: Bad rope materials can be thrown out in the trash can by the road, but there is one Lily can find that can be converted into a good material with a special item.
Tip: Many items can serve more than one purpose. If stuck, use whatever you have at your disposal.
Tip: In the year 2005, 4,881 pedestrians were killed by traffic crashes in the United States.
Tip: Some puzzles have more than one solution to them. This can sometimes lead to different paths.
Tip: Important information found in files can be reviewed any time in the Stuff menu.
Tip: When determining between good and bad rope, it is possible to keep testing singular parts and seeing how they affect Lily in the well.
Tip: Starting a New Game won't cause progress that affects multiple playthroughs to be erased.
Tip: An autosave is created whenever the map changes. If a bad decision is made, it can be erased by exiting the game before going to another map screen.
Tip: Some DEAD ENDs have different conclusions depending on Lily's actions despite the ending remaining the same.
Tip: The average water temperature of Lake Champlain in spring is 39.2°F. (4°C for those in other countries.)
Tip: If you're having a really hard time with a puzzle and are ready to pull your hair out... \!Check to see if anyone made a walkthrough online lol.
Tip: All normal items in the stuff menu need to be found in order to get to the bottom of the well, except for one.
Tip: You will know if you've gotten the true ending when the credits start to roll.
Tip: There's a small detail hidden outside that helps show which main endings have been found.

The stream flows quickly from the rain.
While the water only goes up to your knees, it could easily drag you under.
Would you like to ignore the rock path and wade through the water?
Soon after your feet enter the water, the stream's flow knocks you off balance.
You land on your side, but the sheer strength of the water prevents you from getting up.
As you keep struggling to stand up, you are carried further and further away from your home.
Would you like to try and wade through to search anyway?
Soon after your feet enter the water, the stream's flow knocks you off balance.
You land on your side, but the sheer strength of the water prevents you from getting up.
As you keep struggling to stand up, you are carried further and further away from your home.
There's nothing to take from the water.

A shame you don't have an oversized lollipop to complete the look.

Would you like to wear the Pajamas?
Now don't worry. This doesn't mean that you're suddenly robbing Lily of her happy ending.
That is still how the story ends. Your involvement does not change that.
...Right. You selected this option for information on Lily's pajamas.
Some of you might think that this costume could let Lily just go back to bed.
It won't. It is purely cosmetic.\! Like the rest of the costumes.
I can tell you that the possibility of Lily just ignoring a cry for help just doesn't exist.
Some people have that kindness taken from them, but both of them will hold onto it forever.
